should set the `flush` parameter to `true` to make sure that the state information is flushed. 使用此设置时，编码器将忽略无效字节的数据块的末尾，并清除内部缓冲区。With this setting, the encoder ignores invalid bytes at the end of the data block and clears the internal buffer. 根据当前的回退设置转换是一个逻辑单元，如代理项对的高代理项的一部分的任何剩余处理的数据。Any remaining processed data that is part of a logical unit, such as the high surrogate of a surrogate pair, is converted according to the current fallback settings. `Convert`方法旨在用于在循环中编码任意数量的输入，例如从文件或流中读取的数据。The `Convert` method is designed to be used in a loop to encode an arbitrary amount of input, such as data read from a file or stream. 它将编码操作的输出存储在固定大小的缓冲区。It stores the output of the encoding operation in a fixed-size buffer. 如果输出缓冲区不够大，将引发异常但将填充尽可能多的空间，并返回字符读取和写入的字节数。 will throw an exception if the output buffer isn't large enough, but will fill as much space as possible and return the chars read and bytes written. 另请参阅主题的详细的注释。Also see the topic for more comments. `completed`输出参数指示输入缓冲区中的所有数据是否已转换并存储在输出缓冲区中。The `completed` output parameter indicates whether all the data in the input buffer was converted and stored in the output buffer. 此参数设置为`false`如果指定数量的字符`charCount`无法将参数转换不超过指定的字节数`byteCount`参数。This parameter is set to `false` if the number of characters specified by the `charCount` parameter cannot be converted without exceeding the number of bytes specified by the `byteCount` parameter. 在这种情况下，应用程序应使用输出缓冲区的内容也提供了新的输出缓冲区，增量`chars`按指定的字符数的参数`charsUsed`参数，然后调用`Convert`再次方法以处理剩余的输入。In that situation, the application should use the contents of the output buffer or provide a new output buffer, increment the `chars` parameter by the number of characters specified by the `charsUsed` parameter, then call the `Convert` method again to process the remaining input. `completed`参数还可以设置为`false`，即使`charsUsed`和`charCount`参数是否相等。The `completed` parameter can also be set to `false`, even though the `charsUsed` and `charCount` parameters are equal. 如果仍中的数据，则会发生这种情况下对象不在存储`chars`缓冲区。This situation occurs if there is still data in the object that has not been stored in the `chars` buffer.
